---
title: AWS Kinesis Data Analytics monitoring integration
contentType: page
template: basicDoc
---

<!--This documentation was autogenerated-->
<div id="watermark">BETA</div>

<p>Our <a href="https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/infrastructure/integrations-getting-started/getting-started/introduction-infrastructure-integrations">Infrastructure monitoring integrations</a> include an integration for reporting your AWS Kinesis Data Analytics data to our products. Read on to learn more about how to activate the integration and what data it collects.</p>

<h2 id="activate">Activate integration</h2>

<p>To enable this integration follow standard procedures to <a href="https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/infrastructure/infrastructure-integrations/getting-started/connect-aws-integrations-infrastructure">Connect AWS services to Infrastructure</a>.</p>

<h2 id="polling">Configuration and polling</h2>

<p>You can change the polling frequency and filter data using <a href="/docs/integrations/new-relic-integrations/getting-started/configure-polling-frequency-data-collection-cloud-integrations">configuration options</a>.</p>

<p>Default <a href="/docs/infrastructure/amazon-integrations/aws-integrations-list/aws-polling-intervals-infrastructure-integrations">polling</a> information for the AWS Kinesis Data Analytics integration:</p>

<ul>
	<li>New Relic polling interval: 5 minutes</li>
	<li>Amazon CloudWatch data interval: 1 minute</li>
</ul>

<h2 id="find-data">Find and use data</h2>

<p>To find your integration data in Infrastructure, go to <b><a href="https://infrastructure.newrelic.com/" target="_blank" title="Link opens in a new window.">infrastructure.newrelic.com </a>&gt; AWS</b> and select an integration.</p>

<p>Data is attached to the following <a href="https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/insights/use-insights-ui/getting-started/introduction-new-relic-insights#event-type">event type</a>:</p>

<table>
	<thead>
		<tr>
			<th>Entity</th>
			<th>Event Type</th>
			<th>Provider</th>
		</tr>
	</thead>
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td>Application</td>
			<td><code>AwsKinesisAnalyticsApplicationSample</code></td>
			<td><code>AwsKinesisAnalyticsApplication</code></td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>ApplicationKpu</td>
			<td><code>AwsKinesisAnalyticsApplicationSample</code></td>
			<td><code>AwsKinesisAnalyticsApplication</code></td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>Task</td>
			<td><code>AwsKinesisAnalyticsTaskSample</code></td>
			<td><code>AwsKinesisAnalyticsTask</code></td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>TaskOperator</td>
			<td><code>AwsKinesisAnalyticsTaskOperatorSample</code></td>
			<td><code>AwsKinesisAnalyticsTaskOperator</code></td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>TaskParallelism</td>
			<td><code>AwsKinesisAnalyticsTaskParallelismSample</code></td>
			<td><code>AwsKinesisAnalyticsTaskParallelism</code></td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>TaskOperatorParallelism</td>
			<td><code>AwsKinesisAnalyticsTaskOperatorParallelismSample</code></td>
			<td><code>AwsKinesisAnalyticsTaskOperatorParallelism</code></td>
		</tr>
	</tbody>
</table>

<p>For more on how to use your data, see <a href="https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/infrastructure/integrations/find-use-infrastructure-integration-data">Understand and use integration data</a>.</p>

<h2 id="metrics">Metric data</h2>

<p>This integration collects AWS Kinesis Data Analytics data for Application, ApplicationKpu, Task, TaskOperator, TaskParallelism and TaskOperatorParallelism.</p>

<h3>Kinesis Data Analytics Application data</h3>

<table>
	<thead>
		<tr>
			<th style="width:275px">Metric</th>
			<th style="width:150px">Unit</th>
			<th>Description</th>
		</tr>
	</thead>
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>bytesConsumedRate</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>BytesPerSecond</td>
			<td>The average number of bytes consumed per second for a topic.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>commitsFailed</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The total number of offset commit failures to Kafka, if offset committing and checkpointing are enabled.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>commitsSucceeded</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The total number of successful offset commits to Kafka, if offset committing and checkpointing are enabled.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>cpuUtilization</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Percent</td>
			<td>Overall percentage of CPU utilization across task managers. For example, if there are five task managers, Kinesis Data Analytics publishes five samples of this metric per reporting interval.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>currentInputWatermark</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Milliseconds</td>
			<td>The last watermark this application/operator/task/thread has received.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>currentOutputWatermark</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Milliseconds</td>
			<td>The last watermark this application/operator/task/thread has emitted.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>downtime</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Milliseconds</td>
			<td>For jobs currently in a failing/recovering situation, the time elapsed during this outage.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>fullRestarts</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The total number of times this job has fully restarted since it was submitted. This metric does not measure fine-grained restarts.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>heapMemoryUtilization</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Percent</td>
			<td>Overall heap memory utilization across task managers. For example, if there are five task managers, Kinesis Data Analytics publishes five samples of this metric per reporting interval.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>lastCheckpointDuration</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Milliseconds</td>
			<td>The time it took to complete the last checkpoint.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>lastCheckpointSize</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Bytes</td>
			<td>The total size of the last checkpoint.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>numRecordsInPerSecond</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>CountPerSecond</td>
			<td>The total number of records this operator or task has received per second.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>numRecordsOut</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The total number of records this operator or task has emitted.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>numRecordsOutPerSecond</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>CountPerSecond</td>
			<td>The total number of records this operator or task has emitted per second.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>numberOfFailedCheckpoints</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The number of times checkpointing has failed.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>numRecordsIn</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The total number of records this operator or task has received.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>oldGenerationGcCount</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The total number of old garbage collection operations that have occurred across all task managers.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>oldGenerationGcTime</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Milliseconds</td>
			<td>The total time spent performing old garbage collection operations.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>recordsLagMax</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The maximum lag in terms of number of records for any partition in this window.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>threadsCount</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The total number of live threads used by the application.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>uptime</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Milliseconds</td>
			<td>The time that the job has been running without interruption.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>bytes</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Bytes</td>
			<td>The number of bytes read (per input stream) or written (per output stream).</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>inputProcessing.DroppedRecords</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The number of records returned by a Lambda function that were marked with Dropped status.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>inputProcessing.Duration</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Milliseconds</td>
			<td>The time taken for each AWS Lambda function invocation performed by Kinesis Data Analytics.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>inputProcessing.OkBytes</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The sum of bytes of the records returned by a Lambda function that were marked with Ok status.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>inputProcessing.OkRecords</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The number of records returned by a Lambda function that were marked with Ok status.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>inputProcessing.ProcessingFailedRecords</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The number of records returned by a Lambda function that were marked with ProcessingFailed status.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>inputProcessing.Success</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The number of successful Lambda invocations by Kinesis Data Analytics.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>lambdaDelivery.DeliveryFailedRecords</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The number of records returned by a Lambda function that were marked with DeliveryFailed status.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>lambdaDelivery.Duration</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Milliseconds</td>
			<td>The time taken for each Lambda function invocation performed by Kinesis Data Analytics.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>lambdaDelivery.OkRecords</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The number of records returned by a Lambda function that were marked with Ok status.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>millisBehindLatest</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Milliseconds</td>
			<td>Indicates how far behind from the current time an application is reading from the streaming source.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>records</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The number of records read (per input stream) or written (per output stream).</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>success</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>1 for each successful delivery attempt to the destination configured for your application; 0 for every failed delivery attempt. The average value of this metric indicates how many successful deliveries are performed.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>bytesRequestedPerFetch</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Bytes</td>
			<td>The bytes requested in a single call to getRecords.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>committedOffsets</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Other</td>
			<td>The last successfully committed offsets to Kafka, for each partition. A particular partition's metric can be specified by topic name and partition id.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>currentOffsets</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Other</td>
			<td>The consumer's current read offset, for each partition. A particular partition's metric can be specified by topic name and partition id.</td>
		</tr>
	</tbody>
</table>

<h3>Kinesis Data Analytics ApplicationKpu data</h3>

<table>
	<thead>
		<tr>
			<th style="width:275px">Metric</th>
			<th style="width:150px">Unit</th>
			<th>Description</th>
		</tr>
	</thead>
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>KPUs</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>
			<p>The number of Kinesis Processing Units (KPUs) currently in use.</p>

			<p><strong>Known issue</strong>: as this metric has a longer lag than the rest, in some cases, it's not shown</p>
			</td>
		</tr>
	</tbody>
</table>

<h3>Kinesis Data Analytics Task data</h3>

<table>
	<thead>
		<tr>
			<th style="width:275px">Metric</th>
			<th style="width:150px">Unit</th>
			<th>Description</th>
		</tr>
	</thead>
	<tbody>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>commitsFailed</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The total number of offset commit failures to Kafka, if offset committing and checkpointing are enabled.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>commitsSucceeded</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The total number of successful offset commits to Kafka, if offset committing and checkpointing are enabled.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>currentInputWatermark</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Milliseconds</td>
			<td>The last watermark this task has received.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>currentOutputWatermark</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Milliseconds</td>
			<td>The currently output watermark.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>numLateRecordsDropped</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The number of records this task has dropped due to arriving late.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>numRecordsIn</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The total number of records this task has received.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>numRecordsInPerSecond</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>CountPerSecond</td>
			<td>The total number of records this task has received per second.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>numRecordsOut</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The total number of records this task has emitted.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>numRecordsOutPerSecond</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>CountPerSecond</td>
			<td>The total number of records this task has emitted per second.</td>
		</tr>
		<tr>
			<td>
			<p><code>recordsLagMax</code></p>
			</td>
			<td>Count</td>
			<td>The maximum lag in terms of number of records for any partition in this window.</td>
		</tr>
	</tbody>
</table>

<h2 id="more_help">For more help</h2>
